name: Mario (Classic)
description: The energetic and courageous hero of the Mushroom Kingdom, always ready for adventure, jumping, and saving Princess Peach.

name: Mario (8-Bit)
description: Mario in his classic 8-bit form, a retro reminder of his early adventures on the NES.

name: Mario (64)
description: Mario's appearance in Super Mario 64, marking his transition to 3D gaming and open-world exploration.

name: Mario (Aviator)
description: Mario dressed as an aviator, prepared to take to the skies in his vintage flying gear.

name: Mario (Baseball)
description: Mario sporting a baseball uniform, ready to knock it out of the park with his sporty attire.

name: Mario (Black Suit)
description: Mario in a stylish black suit, suited for formal occasions or undercover missions.

name: Mario (Black Tuxedo)
description: A dapper look for Mario in a formal black tuxedo, perfect for fancy events.

name: Mario (Bowser)
description: Mario disguised as his arch-rival Bowser, a comical and unexpected transformation.

name: Mario (Boxers)
description: A casual look for Mario, wearing only his boxer shorts, ready for a relaxing day or a quick nap.

name: Mario (Builder)
description: Mario dressed as a construction worker, ready to build and create in any kingdom.

name: Mario (Caveman)
description: Mario in a primitive caveman outfit, embracing his prehistoric side.

name: Mario (Chef)
description: Mario donning a chef's hat and apron, cooking up culinary delights in the Luncheon Kingdom.

name: Mario (Captain)
description: Mario in a captain's uniform, ready to set sail on the high seas and navigate treacherous waters.

name: Mario (Clown)
description: Mario all dressed up as a clown, ready to entertain and bring joy to others.

name: Mario (Cowboy)
description: Mario as a rootin' tootin' cowboy, ready to wrangle up stars in the Wild West.

name: Mario (Diddy Kong)
description: Mario mimicking his friend Diddy Kong, sporting his signature red cap.

name: Mario (Doctor)
description: Mario wearing a doctor's coat, ready to heal and assist those in need.

name: Mario (Employee)
description: Mario as a helpful store employee, assisting customers with a smile.

name: Mario (Explorer)
description: Mario equipped for exploration, seeking out new lands and hidden treasures.

name: Mario (Fashionable)
description: Mario in stylish modern clothes, fitting for a city adventure in the Metro Kingdom.

name: Mario (Football)
description: Mario geared up for a game of football (soccer), showing off his athletic skills.

name: Mario (Gold)
description: Mario entirely covered in gleaming gold, a symbol of his achievements.

name: Mario (Golf)
description: Mario ready to tee off on the green, showcasing his golfing prowess.

name: Mario (Hakama)
description: Mario in traditional Hakama, a formal Japanese garment worn in Bowser's Kingdom.

name: Mario (Happi)
description: Mario wearing a festive Happi coat, celebrating a festival in Bowser's Kingdom.

name: Mario (High Poly)
description: A more detailed, higher polygon model of Mario, showcasing enhanced graphics.

name: Mario (King)
description: Mario dressed in regal attire as a king, ruling over his kingdom.

name: Mario (Knight)
description: Mario clad in shining knight's armor, a symbol of bravery and chivalry.

name: Mario (Luigi)
description: Mario disguised as his brother Luigi, a comical and affectionate impersonation.

name: Mario (Mechanic)
description: Mario as a skilled mechanic, fixing vehicles and machinery.

name: Mario (Musician)
description: Mario as a talented musician, playing instruments and composing melodies.

name: Mario (Painter)
description: Mario as a creative painter, expressing himself through colorful artwork.

name: Mario (Peach)
description: Mario disguised as Princess Peach, a humorous and unexpected transformation.

name: Mario (Pirate)
description: Mario as a swashbuckling pirate, searching for buried treasure on the high seas.

name: Mario (Poncho)
description: Mario wearing a traditional poncho, blending in with the locals of the Sand Kingdom.

name: Mario (Resort)
description: Mario dressed for a relaxing stay at a tropical resort in the Seaside Kingdom.

name: Mario (Sailor)
description: Mario in a classic sailor's outfit, ready to set sail on the ocean in the Seaside Kingdom.

name: Mario (Samurai)
description: Mario as a valiant samurai warrior, clad in traditional armor in Bowser's Kingdom.

name: Mario (Satellaview)
description: Mario's appearance as seen on the Satellaview, a nostalgic trip back in time.

name: Mario (Scientist)
description: Mario as a brilliant scientist, conducting experiments and making discoveries.

name: Mario (Skeleton)
description: Mario dressed up as a spooky skeleton, ready for a Halloween adventure.

name: Mario (Snow)
description: Mario bundled up in warm winter clothes, enjoying the snowy landscapes of the Snow Kingdom.

name: Mario (Space)
description: Mario in a spacesuit, ready for interstellar exploration and zero-gravity fun.

name: Mario (Sunshine)
description: Mario as he appeared in Super Mario Sunshine, equipped with the F.L.U.D.D. water cannon.

name: Mario (Swimwear)
description: Mario ready for a swim in his stylish swimwear, enjoying the beaches of the Lake Kingdom.

name: Mario (Topper)
description: Mario imitating the Broodal, Topper, known for his green hat and mischievous antics.

name: Mario (Tuxedo)
description: Mario dressed in a classy white tuxedo, perfect for a moonlit occasion in the Moon Kingdom.

name: Mario (Waluigi)
description: Mario impersonating Waluigi, known for his lanky appearance and scheming personality.

name: Mario (Wario)
description: Mario mimicking Wario, the greedy and muscular rival, complete with a mustache.

name: Luigi
description: Mario's often timid but brave younger brother, known for his green attire and ghost-hunting skills.

name: Peach
description: The kind-hearted princess of the Mushroom Kingdom, often kidnapped by Bowser but always resilient.

name: Peach (Explorer)
description: Peach ready for adventure, dressed in practical explorer gear to uncover hidden secrets.

name: Peach (Farmer)
description: Peach in her farming clothes, tending to the fields of the Mushroom Kingdom with care.

name: Peach (Summer)
description: Peach in a breezy summer dress, enjoying the warm sunshine and vibrant colors of summer.

name: Peach (Swimwear)
description: Peach ready to take a dip, wearing a stylish swimsuit in the sunny Seaside Kingdom.

name: Peach (Wedding)
description: Peach in her beautiful wedding gown, though the ceremony was interrupted, she remains hopeful.

name: Peach (Winter)
description: Peach bundled up for the cold, enjoying the winter wonderland of the Snow Kingdom.

name: Peach (Yukata)
description: Peach in a traditional yukata, possibly attending a festival or event in Bowser's Kingdom.

name: Bowser
description: The King of the Koopas and Mario's nemesis, always scheming to take over the Mushroom Kingdom with his army.

name: Bowser (Ball A)
description: Bowser transformed into a spherical ball, a comical and unexpected shape.

name: Bowser (Ball B)
description: Bowser in another ball form, rolling around and causing chaos in his wake.

name: Bowser (Hat)
description: Bowser's spiky shell hat, a symbol of his power and Koopa authority.

name: Bowser (Suit)
description: Bowser dressed in a suit, a rare formal look for the Koopa king attending a special event.

name: Yoshi
description: A friendly dinosaur known for his flutter jump, enormous appetite, and loyalty to Mario.

name: Yoshi Egg
description: Yoshi's egg, a symbol of new life and potential for adventure.

name: Cappy
description: A sentient hat from the Cap Kingdom and Mario's helpful companion, assisting in capturing enemies.

name: Tiara
description: Peach's magical tiara, a symbol of her royalty and connection to the Mushroom Kingdom.

name: Captain Toad
description: The adventurous leader of the Toad Brigade, always seeking treasure and exploring new frontiers.

name: Toadette
description: A cheerful Toad with a pink mushroom cap, often seen helping Mario on his adventures.

name: Hint Toad
description: A helpful Toad who provides hints and tips to Mario on his journey.

name: Toad
description: A common resident of the Mushroom Kingdom, often seen assisting Mario in his quests.

name: Pauline (Dress)
description: Pauline, the Mayor of New Donk City, known for her elegance and leadership.

name: Pauline (Mayor)
description: Pauline, the Mayor of New Donk City, who also sings beautifully and supports Mario in his adventures.

name: Big Chain Chomp
description: A massive Chain Chomp, known for its strength and destructive power.

name: Chain Chomp
description: A ferocious Chain Chomp, often chained up but ready to break free and cause havoc.

name: Chargin' Chuck
description: A football-playing Koopa Troopa, known for charging at Mario with great force.

name: Fire Bros
description: Koopa Troopas that throw fireballs, making them a challenging enemy to dodge.

name: Hammer Bros
description: Koopa Troopas that throw hammers, posing a significant threat to Mario.

name: Goomba
description: A common enemy in the Mushroom Kingdom, easy to defeat but often found in large numbers.

name: Goombette
description: A female Goomba, often seen alongside other Goombas in the Mushroom Kingdom.

name: Paragoomba
description: A Goomba with wings, capable of flying and hovering above Mario.

name: Micro Goomba
description: A tiny Goomba, often found in groups and easy to defeat.

name: Spiny
description: A spiky enemy that can damage Mario if touched, requiring careful handling.

name: Bullet Bill
description: A fast-moving projectile enemy that shoots straight at Mario, requiring quick reflexes to avoid.

name: Banzai Bill
description: A massive version of Bullet Bill, extremely dangerous and difficult to dodge.

name: Sherm
description: A tank-like enemy that shoots projectiles from a distance, requiring strategy to defeat.

name: Trapeetle
description: A beetle-like enemy that can be flipped over to defeat, often found in grassy areas.

name: Hariet
description: One of the Broodals, a group of rabbit-like enemies who serve Bowser.

name: Fuzzy
description: A fuzzy enemy that can latch onto Mario, causing damage if not shaken off quickly.

name: Pokio
description: A bird-like creature with a long beak, found in the Seaside Kingdom and used for climbing.

name: Urban Stingby
description: A worm-like enemy often found in urban environments, capable of flying and attacking Mario.

name: Urban Stingby (Worm)
description: Another form of the Urban Stingby, slithering through the city streets and posing a threat to Mario.

name: Uproot
description: A strange enemy with extendable legs, capable of reaching great heights to attack Mario.

name: Rabbit
description: A common rabbit, hopping around and minding its own business in the Mushroom Kingdom.

name: Burrbo
description: A dragon-like enemy, soaring through the skies and attacking Mario with fire breath.

name: Burrbo (Ruined Kingdom)
description: A unique Burrbo found exclusively in the desolate Ruined Kingdom, known for its aggressive behavior.

name: Ty-Foo
description: An enemy that blows wind, pushing Mario around with its gusts and making navigation difficult.

name: Cheep Cheep
description: A fish enemy, swimming through the waters of the Seaside Kingdom and jumping out to attack Mario.

name: Frog
description: A common frog, hopping around and enjoying the wetlands of the Lake Kingdom.

name: Lochlady
description: A graceful resident of Lake Lamode, known for her elegance and helpful nature.

name: Gushen
description: An enemy that shoots water, often found in the Seaside Kingdom and used for solving puzzles.

name: Sea Man
description: A local of the Seaside Kingdom who gives quests to Mario, often involving exploration and challenges.

name: Sea Woman
description: A local of the Seaside Kingdom who offers Mario challenges, often related to swimming and diving.

name: Runaway Lizard
description: A fast-moving lizard that runs away from Mario, but may bite if cornered.

name: Tostarenan (M)
description: A male resident of Tostarena, often seen in the Sand Kingdom and involved in local quests.

name: Tostarenan (L)
description: A female resident of Tostarena, known for her wisdom and involvement in the Sand Kingdom's culture.

name: Chincho
description: A short, mummy-type enemy with a skull for a head.

name: Sphinx (Quiz)
description: A sphinx that asks Mario challenging questions, rewarding him with power moons for correct answers.

name: Jaxi
description: A stone creature that Mario can ride, used for traversing the vast deserts of the Sand Kingdom.

name: T-Rex
description: A massive dinosaur that Mario can ride, known for its strength and ability to break through obstacles.

name: RoboBrood
description: A robotic enemy that serves Bowser, often found in Bowser's Kingdom and capable of powerful attacks.

name: Mollusque-Lanceur
description: An enemy that shoots projectiles, often found in the Seaside Kingdom and requiring quick reflexes to defeat.

name: Bird (Forest)
description: A bird commonly found in the forests of the Mushroom Kingdom, often seen flying between trees.

name: Bird (Eagle)
description: A majestic eagle that soars high above the Bowser's Kingdom, often seen in mountainous areas.

name: Bird (Lake)
description: A bird commonly found near the lakes of the Lake Kingdom, often seen perched on rocks or flying over water.

name: Bird (Gull)
description: A seagull commonly found in the Seaside Kingdom, often seen flying over the ocean or resting on the beach.

name: Bird (Lava)
description: A bird adapted to hot environments, often seen flying over lava pools in the Luncheon Kingdom.

name: Bird (Sand)
description: A bird commonly found in the deserts of the Sand Kingdom, often seen flying over sand dunes.

name: Bird (Snow)
description: A bird adapted to cold environments, often seen flying over snowy landscapes in the Snow Kingdom.

name: Bird (Waterfall)
description: A bird commonly found near waterfalls in the Cascade Kingdom, often seen perched on rocks or flying through mist.

name: Bird (Cap)
description: A bird commonly found in the Cap Kingdom, often seen flying around the hat-shaped structures.

name: Bird (City)
description: A bird commonly found in the urban environment of the Metro Kingdom, often seen perched on buildings or flying through the city streets.

name: Bird (Cloud)
description: A bird commonly found in the Cloud Kingdom, often seen flying through the fluffy clouds.

name: Bird (Sky)
description: A bird that soars high in the sky, often seen in the Cloud Kingdom and other high-altitude areas.

name: Bird
description: A regular bird commonly found throughout the Mushroom Kingdom, often seen flying or perched in trees.

name: Glydon
description: A creature that Mario can ride to glide through the air, often found in the Cloud Kingdom.

name: Lakitu
description: A Koopa Troopa that rides a cloud, often seen throwing Spiny Eggs at Mario.

name: Lakitu (Cloud)
description: A Lakitu that resides in the Cloud Kingdom, often seen flying high above the clouds.

name: Klepto
description: A mischievous enemy that steals items from Mario, requiring quick action to retrieve them.

name: Karon Wing
description: A winged version of a Dry Bones, often seen flying around and attacking Mario.

name: Bonneton Female
description: A female resident of Bonneton, known for selling hats and assisting Mario in the Cap Kingdom.

name: Bonneton Male
description: A male resident of Bonneton, known for designing hats and assisting Mario in the Cap Kingdom.

name: Topper
description: One of the Broodals, a group of rabbit-like enemies who serve Bowser and are known for their green hats.

name: Madame Broode
description: A large, intimidating enemy who serves Bowser, often seen riding a Chain Chomp in the Cap Kingdom.

name: Madame Broode (Wanwan)
description: Madame Broode's loyal Chain Chomp, known for its aggressive behavior and powerful attacks.

name: Madame Broode (Wanwan Break)
description: Madame Broode's Chain Chomp after breaking free, often causing chaos in the Cap Kingdom.

name: Stairface Ogre
description: A massive ogre that serves as a boss in the Bowser's Kingdom, known for its strength and challenging battles.

name: Dorrie
description: A friendly dinosaur that Mario can ride, often found in the Mushroom Kingdom and used for traversing water.

name: Coin Coffer
description: A treasure chest filled with coins, often found in the Wooded Kingdom and requiring a key to open.

name: Tropical Wiggler
description: A Wiggler found in tropical locations, often seen in the Seaside Kingdom and used for solving puzzles.

name: Joku
description: A stretchy enemy that can extend its body to reach Mario, often found in the Mushroom Kingdom.

name: Moe-Eye
description: An enemy that wears sunglasses and shoots lasers, often found in the Sand Kingdom and requiring strategy to defeat.

name: Koopa
description: A common enemy in the Mushroom Kingdom, often seen walking around and attacking Mario.

name: Poochy
description: A friendly dog-like creature that Mario can ride, often found in the Mushroom Kingdom and used for traversing difficult terrain.

name: Nintendog
description: A virtual pet from the Nintendog series, often seen in the Mushroom Kingdom as a nostalgic reference.

name: Talkatoo
description: A talking bird that provides hints and tips to Mario, often found in the Mushroom Kingdom.

name: Snow Man
description: A snowman commonly found in the Snow Kingdom, often seen standing in snowy areas.

name: Snow Man Leader
description: The leader of the snowmen in the Snow Kingdom, often seen giving quests to Mario.

name: Snow Man Racer
description: A snowman that participates in races in the Snow Kingdom, often seen sliding down snowy hills.

name: Volbonan
description: A resident of the Luncheon Kingdom, often seen cooking and assisting Mario in his adventures.

name: Volbonan (Chef)
description: A chef in the Luncheon Kingdom, known for cooking delicious meals and assisting Mario in his quests.

name: Volbonan (Small, Chef)
description: A small chef in the Luncheon Kingdom, known for preparing tiny dishes and assisting Mario in his adventures.

name: Volbonan (Small)
description: A small resident of the Luncheon Kingdom, often seen assisting Mario in his adventures and solving puzzles.

name: Sheep
description: A common sheep found in the Sand Kingdom.
